articles.headline: Framework of Settlement Is Said to Be Reached in Sumner Redstone Competency Case
articles.snippet: An agreement would end the public spectacle that began in November when a former companion of Mr. Redstone filed suit challenging his mental capacity.
articles.abstract: An agreement would end the public spectacle that began in November when a former companion of Mr. Redstone filed suit challenging his mental capacity.
articles.lead_paragraph: The framework of a settlement has been reached in the salacious legal battle over the mental competency of the ailing media mogul Sumner M. Redstone, two people with knowledge of the discussions said Thursday.

articles.headline: Behind the Scenes at Disney as It Purged a Favorite Son
articles.snippet: Thomas Staggs’s departure from the No. 2 position at the media giant leaves no clear successor for Robert Iger as chief executive.
articles.abstract: Thomas Staggs’s departure from the No. 2 position at the media giant leaves no clear successor for Robert Iger as chief executive.
articles.lead_paragraph: Thomas O. Staggs, then the chief financial officer of the Walt Disney Company, was having lunch with Robert A. Iger and other high-ranking Disney executives in 2003 in the company’s boardroom when food lodged in Mr. Iger’s windpipe.

articles.headline: A Treasury Secretary at the Center of Obama’s Most Pressing Policies
articles.snippet: From sanctions on Iran to regulations that helped foil a giant tax-dodging deal, Jacob J. Lew is at the center of some of the administration’s most prominent policies.
articles.abstract: From sanctions on Iran to regulations that helped foil a giant tax-dodging deal, Jacob J. Lew is at the center of some of the administration’s most prominent policies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Jacob J. Lew, President Obama’s second-term Treasury secretary, has kept such a low profile in these relatively placid economic times, compared with his crisis-era predecessor, that it seemed he might end up best known for his pending decision to pick a woman for portraiture on the $10 bill.

articles.headline: Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton Turn to Attacks on Credentials
articles.snippet: In a change in tenor that may indicate difficulty in unifying Democrats, Mr. Sanders said Mrs. Clinton was unqualified to be president.
articles.abstract: In a change in tenor that may indicate difficulty in unifying Democrats, Mr. Sanders said Mrs. Clinton was unqualified to be president.
articles.lead_paragraph: A Democratic primary campaign in which both candidates prided themselves on civility and debating the issues, rather than stooping to personal attacks, took a fractious turn on Thursday. After Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont called Hillary Clinton unqualified to be president, Democrats faced the prospect of an increasingly contentious nominating process hurting the party’s ability to unite against Republicans in the fall.
articles.byline: By Amy Chozick and Yamiche Alcindor

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Health Care Ideas Bewilder Republican Experts
articles.snippet: Some call his proposals an incoherent mishmash that could hurt millions of newly insured people, but such criticism appears only to bolster his outsider status.
articles.abstract: Some call his proposals an incoherent mishmash that could hurt millions of newly insured people, but such criticism appears only to bolster his outsider status.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Donald J. Trump calls for “a full repeal of Obamacare” but says that “everybody’s got to be covered.” Initially, he liked “the mandate,” a central feature of the Affordable Care Act that requires most Americans to have insurance or pay a penalty, but he backed off that position under fire from conservatives.
articles.byline: By Robert Pear and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Francis’ Message Calls on Church to Be Inclusive
articles.snippet: The pope asked priests to welcome single parents, unmarried couples and gay people, lamenting the “severe stress” of modern families.
articles.abstract: The pope asked priests to welcome single parents, unmarried couples and gay people, lamenting the “severe stress” of modern families.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROME — In a broad proclamation on family life, Pope Francis on Friday called for the Roman Catholic Church to be more welcoming and less judgmental, and he seemingly signaled a pastoral path for divorced and remarried Catholics to receive holy communion.
articles.byline: By Jim Yardley and Laurie Goodstein

articles.headline: U.S. Presses Bid to Force Apple to Unlock iPhone in New York
articles.snippet: In a letter to a federal judge, the Justice Department said it still required help despite its success in gaining iPhone data in a separate case.
articles.abstract: In a letter to a federal judge, the Justice Department said it still required help despite its success in gaining iPhone data in a separate case.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With the legal battle over one iPhone now behind them, lawyers for the Justice Department and Apple resumed their sparring in another case on Friday, as prosecutors told a federal judge in Brooklyn that they still needed the company’s help to unlock a drug dealer’s iPhone.
articles.byline: By Eric Lichtblau and Katie Benner
